paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted variants in the TTR gene, including penetrance data and individual records.

patients.demographics: varied ages and sexes, specific demographics not detailed

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient P1 was diagnosed with cardiac amyloidosis at age 52.
Patient P2 presented with neuropathy symptoms at age 58.
Patient P3 remains asymptomatic despite carrying the variant.

functional_data.summary: The L55P variant disrupts the β-sheet structure, promoting amyloid formation.

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with disease in families with a history of amyloidosis.
variants.additional_notes: The L55P variant is associated with a higher risk of amyloidosis.
key_quotes: The L55P mutation may lead to disruption of the β-sheet structure.
Strong experimental evidence suggests that TTR dissociates into monomeric intermediates.

tables_processed.table_caption: Variants in the TTR gene and their clinical significance

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text and tables.
